panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for AED-RTA
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for the Abnormal Event Detection and Real-Time Advisory(AED-RTA) application. The table below compares the existing installation of this product, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined: 1) a tag provider for AED UDTs and tags, 2) A Database connection for the AED database, and 3) a database connection named "Logs" for the logging database.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms to proceed.

panel.title: Define Tag and Database Providers
panel.preamble: Specify the tag provider and database connection to be used by AED-RTA. These values are used by subsequent screens.

panel.title: Custom Icons for AED-RTA
panel.preamble: Custom icons may be found in many of the user screens.

panel.title: Python Code for AED-RTA
panel.preamble: This page installs Python modules specific to the AED application. The Python is stored outside of the AED project in the Ignition installation directory. It also installs Java jar files, text translation files, and logger configuration files. The JAR files are referenced by Python to access Java functionality. The text translation files are used by the . Thirdly, property files for Internationalization are then stored in the Gateway installation directory: properties/aed/aed.property.

artifact.name: Jar Files to Support External Python

panel.title: Clear / Create / Alter AED-RTA Database
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. WARNING: Do NOT attempt to create a database at an existing AED-RTA installation. The create script will succeed only on a new empty database instance. The alter script should be used to modify/update existing database instances.

panel.title: Install AED Modules
panel.preamble: This page installs the AED-RTA model calculation module.

panel.title: Install Common Logging Module
panel.preamble:
This page installs the common module that provides core common functionality for all ILS modules. It also extends Ignition logging capabilities to include database logging.
It requires an additional database connection named "Logs". The logging table will be created automatically, but the database instance and database connection must be created manually.

panel.title: Install Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create appropriate scanclasses. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Install UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs that are needed by AED/RTA.

panel.title: Install AED Project
panel.preamble: AED is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation.

panel.title: Product Documentation
panel.preamble: The list below contains both user-level and design documents. They may be downloaded individually,as needed.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of the AED-RTA applications in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: AED-RTA - Installed
epilog.preamble: Now that all of the automated installation and configuration of the EMRE AED-RTA Applications is complete, there are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Restart the Gateway, then edit the project setting it to "enabled".
Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.

The AED module or the Common module may be quarantined after install but it may not show up at all until the gateway has been restarted. If you do not see the module in the Configure - Modules page, then restart the gateway. After restart, recheck the Configure - Modules page to see if it is quarantined. If it is, then accept the license and restart the gateway.
